input_text:
Job Title: Production Helper - (West Bend) 3rd Shift

Location: West Bend, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Metalcraft of Mayville
Metalcraft of Mayville is an Equal Opportunity Employer:Minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity
Production Helper - (West Bend) 3rd Shift
US-WI-West Bend
Job ID: 2024-3542
Type: Regular Full-Time
# of Openings: 10
Category: Manufacturing
Metalcraft of Mayville, Inc (West Bend)
Overview
 
 
This role is primarily responsible for de-nesting parts cut by the laser and metal finishing, identifying and organizing the laser cut parts in a Just-in-time fabrication shop. This position also may be required to assist other operators as a helper on key work or machines as required.
Responsibilities
Assist the Operator with setups and operations on Mazak and Mitsubishi CO2 Lasers.Use grinders and sanders to improve quality on partsDe-nesting of laser cut parts and removing laser oxide from parts Cross Train across the Laser department.Properly receiving and storing of steel. Safely operate a forklift to handle materials and complete work. Perform general housekeeping of department.Perform assigned work to time standards and quality expectations.Make routine decisions and use problem solving to resolve basic manufacturing issues. Report and document basic material, production and quality control issues.Ensure compliance with corporate and plant safety standards.Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
High School diploma or GED equivalent requiredAbility to lift up-to 50 pounds, bend, twist and transport product and materials short distancesBasic understanding of computers and ability to perform computer functions as they pertain to the jobAbility to work collaboratively and productively in a team-environmentDemonstrated ability to communicate effectively in both verbal and written formatsAbility to work safely and without injury with hand tools in a an environment with metal and sharp objectsDemonstrated ability to effectively implement or respond to changeWork in an efficient and timely manner.Demonstrated detail orientation, self-motivation skills and ability to multi-task
ExperienceAbility to read and interpret documents such as blueprints operating and maintenance instructions and proceduresStrong metal grinding, forming and basic fabrication backgroundBasic dimensional measuring competence and ability to quickly learn the use of precision measurement tools.Demonstrated competency in basic shop math
 
Metalcraft of Mayville is an Equal Opportunity Employer:
Minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity
PM17
 
PI239191934

Experience Level (if available): None
